2.text: Honour me a little, and I shew thee, That yet for God are words.

3.text: I lift up my knowledge from afar, And to my Maker I ascribe righteousness.

4.text: For, truly, my words are not false, The perfect in knowledge is with thee.

5.text: Lo, God is mighty, and despiseth not, Mighty in power and heart.

6.text: He reviveth not the wicked, And the judgment of the poor appointeth;

7.text: He withdraweth not from the righteous His eyes, And from kings on the throne, And causeth them to sit for ever, and they are high,

8.text: And if prisoners in fetters They are captured with cords of affliction,

9.text: Then He declareth to them their work, And their transgressions, Because they have become mighty,

10.text: And He uncovereth their ear for instruction, And saith that they turn back from iniquity.

11.text: If they do hear and serve, They complete their days in good, And their years in pleasantness.

12.text: And if they do not hearken, By the dart they pass away, And expire without knowledge.

13.text: And the profane in heart set the face, They cry not when He hath bound them.

14.text: Their soul dieth in youth, And their life among the defiled.

15.text: He draweth out the afflicted in his affliction, And uncovereth in oppression their ear.

16.text: And also He moved thee from a strait place, To a broad place—no straitness under it, And the sitting beyond of thy table Hath been full of fatness.

17.text: And the judgment of the wicked thou hast fulfilled, Judgment and justice are upheld—because of fury,

18.text: Lest He move thee with a stroke, And the abundance of an atonement turn thee not aside.

19.text: Doth He value thy riches? He hath gold, and all the forces of power.

20.text: Desire not the night, For the going up of peoples in their stead.

21.text: Take heed—do not turn unto iniquity, For on this thou hast fixed Rather than on affliction.

22.text: Lo, God doth sit on high by His power, Who is like Him—a teacher?

23.text: Who hath appointed unto Him his way? And who said, ‘Thou hast done iniquity?’

24.text: Remember that thou magnify His work That men have beheld.

25.text: All men have looked on it, Man looketh attentively from afar.

26.text: Lo, God is high, And we know not the number of His years, Yea, there is no searching.

27.text: When He doth diminish droppings of the waters, They refine rain according to its vapour,

28.text: Which clouds do drop, They distil on man abundantly.

29.text: Yea, doth any understand The spreadings out of a cloud? The noises of His tabernacle?

30.text: Lo, He hath spread over it His light, And the roots of the sea He hath covered,

31.text: For by them He doth judge peoples, He giveth food in abundance.

32.text: By two palms He hath covered the light, And layeth a charge over it in meeting,

33.text: He sheweth by it to his friend substance, Anger against perversity.
